Detailed Description

Factor Oracle (FO) class.

This class implements the sequence of states, initialisation, access and freeing of FO

Member Function Documentation

int O_oracle::add ( int  letterIn,
int  bufferefIn = -1 
)

Creates and add a state and corresponding arrows in FO.

This function adds a state in Factor Oracle following the construction described in Computing repeated factors with a factor oracle from Arnaud Lefebvre and Thierry Lecroq (June 2000). This implementation adds the reverse suffix links described in Navigating the Oracle: a Heuristic Approach by Gérard Assayag and Georges Bloch (2007)

Returns:
number of the state just added

Definition at line 513 of file Oracle_classes.cpp.

int O_oracle::lrs ( O_state &  state1,
O_state &  state2 
)

Compute the length of common suffix.

Backtrack the suffix path to calculate the length of the common suffix (lrs) between state1 and state2. This algorithm is described in Computing repeated factors with a factor oracle from Arnaud Lefebvre and Thierry Lecroq (June 2000).

Returns:
The lrs

void O_oracle::start (  ) 

Initialisation.

Create the first state of FO (numbered 0) with no transitions, no suffix nor reverse suffix links and set size to 1

Definition at line 350 of file Oracle_classes.cpp.

pair< int, int > O_oracle::suffix ( O_state &  statein,
int  letterIn 
)

Run the suffix oracle core algorithm.

Run the suffix oracle core algorithm backtracking the suffix path and adding transistions until the correct suffix is found

First run the backward search for the suffix as described in Factor oracle, Suffix oracle from Cyril Allauzen, Maxime Crochemore and Mathieu Raffinot (June 1999).

Then run the length of repeated suffix (O_learner::lrs) algorithm added 2000 in Computing repeated factors with a factor oracle by Arnaud Lefebvre and Thierry Lecroq.

Eventually run the checking algorithm developped 2002 in Drastic improvements over repeats found with factor oracle by Arnaud Levebvre, Thierry Lecroq and Joel Alexandre

Returns:
a int pair with the state number of the suffix and the length of the repeated suffix

Definition at line 407 of file Oracle_classes.cpp.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

ostream& operator<< ( ostream &  out,
const O_oracle &  oraclein 
) [friend]

Output all the states of FO on a standard stream.

Output is compliant with the DOT graph description language. This function outputs the header of DOT file and calls O_state::operator<< for every state. 

digraph Oracle
{
  graph [rankdir=LR];
  node [shape=circle];
  nodesep = 0.2;
 
  states_output
 
}
